title: A Flow Cytometry-Based Method for Analyzing DNA End Resection in G<sub>0</sub>- and G<sub>1</sub>-Phase Mammalian Cells
procedures: Synchronization of cells in G0 phaseAbl pre-B cellsDilute imatinib solution in DMEM media to 3 μM.Resuspend abl pre-B cells in DMEM + 3 μM imatinib at 2 × 106 cells/mL.Notes:  1) All cells are cultured at 37°C with 5% CO2. 2) All cells are spun in an Allegra X-14 R centrifuge (Beckman Coulter) at 1,200 rpm for 5 min in procedures spinning is required for collecting cells. Culture abl pre-B cells in DMEM + 3 μM imatinib for at least 48 h.MCF10A cellsPlate 2.5 × 105 MCF10A cells in 5 mL of MCF10A media per well of 6-well tissue culture plates.Culture cells for 1 day.Aspirate media from each well and wash cells with pre-warmed 1× PBS or EGF-free MCF10A media.Add 5 mL of EGF-free MCF10A media to each well and culture cells for 2 days.Verification of G0 synchronization efficiency using BD PharmigenTM BrdU Flow Kit with modification (for both abl pre-B cells and MCF10A cells)Add BrdU to cells (1mL of imatinib-treated abl pre-B cells or 1 well of EGF-deprived MCF10A cells in a 6-well plate) to a final concentration of 10 μM.Note: Make sure to use proliferating cells as a positive control to ensure that the labeling and detection procedures are done appropriately. Incubate cells with BrdU for 30 min.Collect cells in FACS tubes.Abl pre-B cells:Resuspend cells briefly by pipetting and transfer cells directly to FACS tubes.Spin down cells, decant supernatant by inverting tubes quickly to pour out media and tapping the inverted tubes on a paper towel, and wash cells by resuspending them in 1mL of 1X FACS wash, followed by spinning down cells again.Note: Do not use vacuum to avoid loss of samples. MCF10A cells:Remove media and wash cells with 1mL of 1× PBS.Add 300 μL of 0.

25% Trypsin to a well and return cells to the incubator for 5–10 min.Inspect cells under the microscope to ensure that most cells have detached off the plate surface.Add 1 mL of MCF10A media to resuspend cells and transfer cells to FACS tubes.Spin down cells, decant supernatant, and wash cells by resuspending cells in 1 mL of 1× FACS wash, followed by spinning down cells again.Fix cells in 150 μL of BD Cytofix/Cytoperm Buffer at room temperature for 20 min.Wash cells with 1 mL of 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer.Permeabilize cells by one of the following methodsFreeze-and-thaw methodFreeze cells in 0.5 mL of 10% DMSO in FBS at -80°C.Thaw cells at room temperature and wash freeze-thaw cells with 1 mL of 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer.Permeabilization with detergentResuspend cells in 150 μL of BD Permeabilization Plus Buffer and incubate on ice for 10 min.Wash cells with 1 mL of 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer.Fix cells in 150 μL of BD Cytofix/Cytoperm Buffer at room temperature for 5 min.Add 100 μL of 300 μg/mL DNase I (in 1× PBS) to each tube of cells and incubate at 37°C for 1 h.Wash cells with 1 mL of 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer.Stain cells with 100 μL of 1:50 diluted FITC-anti-BrdU antibody (in 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer) at room temperature for 1 h.Wash cells with 1 mL of 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer.Add 15 μL of 7-AAD to each tube of cells and incubate at room temperature for 3 min.Add 300 μL of 1× PBS to each tube.Note: Do not wash off 7-AAD. Add 1× PBS directly to each tube and process flow cytometry analysis directly. Record DNA content (7-AAD) and BrdU incorporation (FITC) on BD FACS Fortessa X-20 or an equivalent flow cytometer.Analyze data using FlowJo (Figure 1).imgsrc:https://en-cdn.bio-protocol.org/attached/image/e4413/bioprotoc-12-10-4413-g001.jpgFigure 1.

Flow cytometric analysis of cycling and G0-arrested abl pre-B cells and MCF10A cells following BrdU labeling. Dot plots depicting cell cycle profiles of cycling and cells arrested in G0 phases by (A) imatinib treatment (abl pre-B cells) or (B) EGF withdrawal (MCF10A) cells after BrdU labeling and flow cytometry analysis for BrdU incorporation (FITC) and DNA content (7-AAD). S (BrdU-positive), G1 (BrdU-negative, 2N DNA), and G2 (BrdU-negative, 4N DNA) cells in cycling cultures and G0 cells (BrdU-negative, 2N DNA) in imatinib-treated abl pre-B cell and EGF-deprived MCF10A cultures are shown in red polygon gates.Monitoring DNA end resection by flow cytometry-based chromatin-bound RPA assay after irradiation in G0-arrested and G1 phase cells in proliferating culturesCell preparationG0 abl pre-B cells: Treat abl pre-B cells with imatinib as indicated in Step A3. Aliquot 1 mL of imatinib-treated cells in wells of a 24-well plate for irradiation.G0 MCF10A cells: Synchronize MCF10A in EGF-free MCF10A media in a 12-well plate as indicated in Step A3 for irradiation.Proliferating abl pre-B cells: Resuspend cells in pre-warmed DMEM media at 2 × 106 cells/mL and aliquot 1 mL of cells in each well of a 24-well plate for irradiation.Proliferating MCF10A cells: Plate 5 × 105 MCF10A cells 5 mL of MCF10A media in a well of a 6-well plate for 24 h before irradiation.For analysis of G1 phase abl pre-B or MCF10A cells from proliferating cultures, incubate cells with 10 μM EdU for 1 h before irradiation.Irradiate cells in XRAD 320 irradiator.Note: The dosage of irradiation and the time of sample collection after IR were determined empirically, based on the distinct RPA staining intensities between 53BP1-proficient (normal DNA end protection, basal levels of resection) and 53BP1-deficient (impaired DNA end protection).

Imatinib-treated (G0) abl pre-B cells: 15Gy IR; cell collected 3–18 h after IREGF-deprived (G0) MCF10A cells: 30 Gy IR; cell collected 4 h after IRProliferating abl pre-B cells: 5 Gy IR; cell collected 3 h after IRProliferating MCF10A cells: 25 Gy IR; cell collected 6 h after IRCollect cells in FACS tubes, spin down, and wash with 1 mL of FACS wash.Pre-extract cells with 150 mL of cold Triton X-100 in 1× PBS on ice for 10 minImatinib-treated (G0) abl pre-B cells: 0.05% Triton X-100EGF-deprived (G0) MCF10A cells: 0.5% Triton X-100Proliferating abl pre-B cells: 0.2% Triton X-100Proliferating MCF10A cells: 0.5% Triton X-100Wash cells with 2 mL of FACS wash.Fix cells in 150 μL of BD Cytofix/Cytoperm Buffer at room temperature for 20 min.Wash cells with 1 mL of FACS wash.Stain cells 100 μL of 1:500 diluted anti-RPA32 and 1:1,000 diluted anti-phospho-H2AX (S139) antibodies (in 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer) at room temperature for 2 h.Wash cells with 1 mL of 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer.Stain cells 100 μL of 1:500 diluted Alexa Fluro 488 goat anti-rat IgG and Alexa Fluro 647 goat anti-mouse IgG (in 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer) at room temperature for 1 hour, protected from light.Wash cells with 1 mL of 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer.For analysis of G1-phase cells in EdU-pulsed proliferating cultures:Note: Click-iT Plus EdU imaging kit is used in place of BrdU labeling kit because DNase I treatment in the procedures of BrdU labeling kit results in poor RPA staining compared to untreated cells. Prepare Click-iT Plus reaction cocktail according to the manufacturer’s instructions.Note: Use Click-iT Plus reaction cocktail within 15 min of preparation. Resuspend cells in each tube in 250 μL of Click-iT Plus reaction cocktail and incubate at room temperature for 30 min, protected from light.Wash cells with 2 mL of 1× BD Perm/Wash Buffer.

Add 15 μL of 7-AAD and incubate at room temperature for 3 min.Add 300 μL of 1× PBS to each tube.Record DNA content (7-AAD), RPA (Alexa Fluro 488), and phospho-H2AX (S139) or EdU (Alexa Fluro 647) on BD FACS Fortessa X-20 or equivalent flow cytometer.Note: The choice of fluorophores should be based on the availability of reagents and the flow cytometers. As we use Alexa Fluro 647 for visualizing phospho-H2AX (S139) and EdU in our RPA assay, we typically do not perform phospho-H2AX (S139) staining in the analysis of proliferating cells. Analyze data using FlowJo (Figure 2).imgsrc:https://en-cdn.bio-protocol.org/attached/image/e4413/bioprotoc-12-10-4413-g002.jpgFigure 2. (C, D) The dot plots on the left show EdU incorporation (Alexa Fluor 647) and DNA content (7-AAD) in cycling abl pre-B (C) and MCF10A (D) cells, with G1 cells shown in the red polygon gates. The histograms on the right show chromatin-bound RPA levels (Alexa Fluor 488) in G1-phase WT or 53BP1-deficient abl pre-B (C) or MCF10A (D) cells, with red polygon gated cells in the dot plots, after IR.
